justification: Analyzed package metrics: Ce=3, Ca=1 => Instability I = 3/(1+3) = 0.75. Outgoing dependencies: com.google.zxing (Ce=2, Ca=36 => I≈0.053), com.google.zxing.common (Ce=1, Ca=29 => I≈0.033), com.google.zxing.common.detector (Ce=2, Ca=8 => I=0.20). All outgoing dependencies have lower instability (are more stable) than com.google.zxing.oned.rss, so the Stable Dependencies Principle is respected and there is no unstable dependency. Incoming dependency com.google.zxing.oned.rss.expanded (Ce=7, Ca=1 => I=0.875) depends on this package, but that does not make com.google.zxing.oned.rss depend on less stable components.

The package has Ce=3, Ca=1 => instability I = 3/(1+3) = 0.75. Its outgoing dependencies: com.google.zxing (Ce=2, Ca=36 => I ≈ 0.0526) and com.google.zxing.common (Ce=1, Ca=29 => I ≈ 0.0333) are more stable (lower I) — these are acceptable. However it also depends on com.google.zxing.oned.rss.expanded (Ce=7, Ca=1 => I = 7/(1+7) = 0.875), which is less stable (higher I) than com.google.zxing.oned.rss.expanded.decoders. This violates the Stable Dependencies Principle. Additionally, com.google.zxing.oned.rss.expanded lists com.google.zxing.oned.rss.expanded.decoders as an incoming dependency (cyclic dependency), which increases instability risk. Therefore an unstable dependency smell is detected.

The package com.google.zxing.pdf417.decoder has Ce=6 and Ca=1 (instability I = 6/(6+1) = 0.857). All of its outgoing dependencies are more stable (lower I) than the package itself: com.google.zxing (Ce=2, Ca=36, I≈0.053), com.google.zxing.common.detector (Ce=2, Ca=8, I=0.200), com.google.zxing.pdf417 (Ce=7, Ca=2, I≈0.778), com.google.zxing.common (Ce=1, Ca=29, I≈0.033), com.google.zxing.pdf417.encoder (Ce=2, Ca=2, I=0.500), com.google.zxing.pdf417.decoder.ec (Ce=3, Ca=1, I=0.750). The incoming dependency from com.google.zxing.pdf417 (I≈0.778) is also more stable than the analyzed package. Because com.google.zxing.pdf417.decoder depends only on packages with lower instability values (i.e., more stable packages), the Unstable Dependency smell is not detected.

Analyzed package metrics: Ce=6, Ca=7 -> Instability I = 6/(6+7) = 0.4615. Outgoing dependencies and their instabilities: com.google.zxing.client.android.result.supplement (Ce=3, Ca=1 -> I=3/4=0.75), com.google.zxing.client.android.camera (Ce=2, Ca=1 -> I=2/3=0.6667), com.google.zxing.client.android.clipboard (Ce=0, Ca=2 -> I=0.0), com.google.zxing (Ce=2, Ca=36 -> I=0.0526), com.google.zxing.client.android.result (Ce=3, Ca=2 -> I=3/5=0.6), com.google.zxing.client.android.history (Ce=3, Ca=2 -> I=3/5=0.6). Four of six outgoing dependencies (result.supplement I=0.75, camera I=0.6667, result I=0.6, history I=0.6) have higher instability than the analyzed package (I=0.4615), meaning the package depends on less stable packages and thus violates the Stable Dependencies Principle. Therefore an Unstable Dependency smell is detected.

Analyzed package has Ce=3 and Ca=1 → instability I = 1/(1+3) = 0.25 (relatively unstable). Its outgoing dependencies are more stable: com.google.zxing (Ce=2, Ca=36 → I = 36/38 ≈ 0.947), com.google.zxing.common.reedsolomon (Ce=0, Ca=8 → I = 8/8 = 1.0), com.google.zxing.common (Ce=1, Ca=29 → I = 29/30 ≈ 0.967). Incoming package com.google.zxing.maxicode is even more unstable (Ce=3, Ca=0 → I = 0), and depends on this package. Because the analyzed package depends only on packages with substantially higher stability indices, it does not violate the Stable Dependencies Principle — no unstable-dependency smell detected.

com.google.zxing.common.reedsolomon has Ce=0 and Ca=8 (instability I = 0/(8+0) = 0) and has no outgoing dependencies. It does not depend on any other packages (outgoing_dependencies = []), while eight packages depend on it (com.google.zxing.maxicode.decoder, com.google.zxing.pdf417.decoder.ec, com.google.zxing.qrcode.decoder, com.google.zxing.qrcode.encoder, com.google.zxing.datamatrix.decoder, com.google.zxing.aztec.detector, com.google.zxing.aztec.decoder, com.google.zxing.aztec.encoder). Because it is highly stable (I=0) and has no unstable outgoing dependencies, the Unstable Dependency smell is not present.

Analyzed package com.google.zxing.oned.rss.expanded has Ce=7, Ca=1 -> Instability I=7/(7+1)=0.875. Outgoing dependencies and their instabilities: com.google.zxing.oned.rss.expanded.decoders (Ce=3, Ca=1 -> I=0.75), com.google.zxing.client.result (Ce=2, Ca=6 -> I=0.25), com.google.zxing.common.detector (Ce=2, Ca=8 -> I=0.20), com.google.zxing.oned (Ce=2, Ca=2 -> I=0.50), com.google.zxing (Ce=2, Ca=36 -> I≈0.053), com.google.zxing.oned.rss (Ce=3, Ca=1 -> I=0.75), com.google.zxing.common (Ce=1, Ca=29 -> I≈0.033). All outgoing dependencies have lower instability (are more stable) than the analyzed package, so the Stable Dependencies Principle is not violated. There is a mutual dependency with com.google.zxing.oned.rss.expanded.decoders, but that package's instability (0.75) is still lower than 0.875, therefore no Unstable Dependency smell is detected.

com.google.zxing.pdf417 has Ce=7 and Ca=2 (instability I = 7/(7+2) ≈ 0.78). One of its outgoing dependencies is com.google.zxing.pdf417.decoder (Ce=6, Ca=1, I = 6/(6+1) ≈ 0.86), which is less stable (higher I) than com.google.zxing.pdf417. This violates the Stable Dependencies Principle (a package should only depend on packages more stable than itself). Additionally, com.google.zxing.pdf417.decoder appears in both outgoing and incoming dependency lists (mutual/cyclic dependency), reinforcing the unstable dependency architecture. Therefore the Unstable Dependency smell is detected.

The package has Ce=0 and no outgoing dependencies (outgoing_dependencies is empty), so it does not depend on any other packages; incoming_dependencies is also empty (Ca=0). Because it has no efferent couplings, there is no dependency on less-stable packages and therefore the Unstable Dependency smell is not present.

Compute instability I = Ce / (Ca + Ce). com.google.zxing.client.result: Ce=2, Ca=6 → I = 2/8 = 0.25 (relatively stable). Outgoing dependency com.google.zxing.oned: Ce=2, Ca=2 → I = 2/4 = 0.5 (more unstable). Outgoing dependency com.google.zxing: Ce=2, Ca=36 → I = 2/38 ≈ 0.0526 (more stable). Because com.google.zxing.client.result (I=0.25) depends on com.google.zxing.oned (I=0.5), it depends on a less stable package, violating the Stable Dependencies Principle. The presence of multiple incoming dependencies (Ca=6) further indicates com.google.zxing.client.result is relatively stable and should not depend on a more unstable package, so the Unstable Dependency smell is detected.

Analyzed package com.google.zxing.client.android.wifi has Ce=1 and Ca=0 (instability I = 0/(0+1) = 0.0 — very unstable). It has one outgoing dependency: com.google.zxing.client.result (Ce=2, Ca=6, instability I = 6/(6+2) = 0.75 — more stable). There are no incoming dependencies. Because the package depends on a more stable package (dependency direction follows the Stable Dependencies Principle), the Unstable Dependency smell is not present.

Unstable Dependency smell not detected.

All outgoing dependencies have lower instability (more stable) than com.google.zxing.qrcode.encoder (0.667 > 0.429, 0.053, 0.033, 0.000). Therefore the package does not depend on less stable components and does not exhibit the Unstable Dependency smell.

Its outgoing dependencies are com.google.zxing (Ce=2, Ca=36, I = 36/(36+2) ≈ 0.947) and com.google.zxing.common (Ce=1, Ca=29, I = 29/(29+1) ≈ 0.967). Both target packages are substantially more stable (higher I) than com.google.zxing.oned, so the Stable Dependencies Principle is respected and there is no unstable dependency. Incoming dependencies do not create an unstable dependency smell for this package.

com.google.zxing.client.android.book has Ce=1 and Ca=0 -> Instability I = Ce/(Ca+Ce) = 1.0 (very unstable). It has a single outgoing dependency to com.google.zxing.client.android which has Ce=6 and Ca=7 -> Instability I = 6/(6+7) ≈ 0.462. Because the dependency's instability (≈0.462) is lower than the analyzed package's instability (1.0), the dependency is directed toward a more stable package, complying with the Stable Dependencies Principle. No unstable dependency smell detected.

com.google.zxing.aztec has Ce=4 and Ca=3 (stability = 3/(3+4) = 0.429). It depends on com.google.zxing (stability = 36/(36+2) = 0.947) and com.google.zxing.common (stability = 29/(29+1) = 0.967) which are more stable (acceptable), but it also depends on com.google.zxing.aztec.encoder (Ce=5, Ca=3, stability = 3/(3+5) = 0.375) and com.google.zxing.aztec.detector (Ce=6, Ca=1, stability = 1/(1+6) = 0.143), both of which are less stable than com.google.zxing.aztec. Those outgoing dependencies to less-stable packages violate the Stable Dependencies Principle, therefore an Unstable Dependency smell is detected.

com.google.zxing has Ce=2 and Ca=36 => instability I = 2/(36+2) = 0.0526 (stable). It has outgoing dependencies to: com.google.zxing.common (Ce=1, Ca=29 => I = 1/30 = 0.0333) and com.google.zxing.common.detector (Ce=2, Ca=8 => I = 2/10 = 0.2). The dependency to com.google.zxing.common.detector violates the Stable Dependencies Principle because com.google.zxing depends on a less stable package (I_common.detector = 0.2 > I_com.google.zxing = 0.0526). Therefore an Unstable Dependency smell is detected. The dependency to com.google.zxing.common is acceptable (more stable: 0.0333 < 0.0526).

com.google.zxing.common (Ce=1, Ca=29, Instability I=1/(1+29)=0.0333) has an outgoing dependency on com.google.zxing (Ce=2, Ca=36, I=2/(2+36)=0.0526). According to the Stable Dependencies Principle, a package should only depend on packages that are more stable (lower I) than itself. Here com.google.zxing.common is more stable (lower I) than its dependency com.google.zxing, so it depends on a less stable package. The high Ca (29) and low Ce (1) indicate com.google.zxing.common is a stable package relied on by many incoming packages, which reinforces that its dependency on the less stable com.google.zxing is an unstable dependency smell.
